Category:Legends articles with new canon content

nodes.text: Star Wars in 100 Scenes is a Star Wars Legends reference book that provides a visual overview of the six films of the Star Wars original trilogy and prequel trilogy. It was written by Jason Fry and published by DK Publishing on August 18, 2014.

Relive the most dramatic and iconic moments from the epic six-part saga, Star Wars, one spread at a time in DK's Star Wars in 100 Scenes. Presented in chronological movie order, every hand picked scene is explored and explained. Learn in-depth facts about the key characters, droids, vehicles, and locations of each scene. Bits of real-world information are scattered throughout to give insight into the behind-the scenes world of the Star Wars saga.

A perfect way to prepare for the highly anticipated Episode VII The Force Awakens, Star Wars in 100 Scenes is the ideal go-to resource for fans who just want to brush-up on their Star Wars knowledge or for the new generation of kids eager to start their journey into a galaxy far, far away….
This book's development predates the Lucasfilm Story Group, and the information in it is not considered part of canon.
